{{cpp/memory/polymorphic_allocator/title|delete_object}}
{{cpp/memory/polymorphic_allocator/navbar}}

{{ddcl|since=c++20|
template&lt; class U &gt;
void delete_object( U* p );
}}

Destroys the object of type {{tt|U}} and deallocates storage allocated for it.

Equivalent to&lt;br&gt;
{{c|std::allocator_traits&lt;polymorphic_allocator&gt;::destroy(*this, p);
deallocate_object(p);
}}

===Parameters===
{{par begin}}
{{par|p|pointer to the object to destroy and deallocate}}
{{par end}}

===Exceptions===
Throws nothing.

===Notes===
This function was introduced for use with the fully-specialized allocator {{c|std::pmr::polymorphic_allocator&lt;&gt;}}, but it may be useful in any specialization.
